newsitem.title: MEXICO: RESEARCH ALERT - Banacci downgraded to sell.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Banacci downgraded to sell.

text.p: Credit Lyonnais Securities has downgraded Grupo Financiero Banacci to a sell from a hold due to the shares' premium valuation, it said on Thursday.

- "Although we remain reasonably bullish on the group's medium term outlook, at 1.8 times current book value and 18.0 times our 1997 EPS estimate, the upside appears limited," analyst Andrew Collins wrote.
- He said the bank's shares have risen 15 percent in the last several weeks on the back of sharp declines in Mexico's interest rates, but that room for further improvement is limited.
- "Moreover, the shares are currently trading at a 20 percent premium to the 'B' sahres of GF Bancomer, the most comparable peer," he said.
- He said that premium should narrow to 10 to 15 percent.
